de.cocolab.reuse.test
Class IODrv

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.lang.Thread
        |
        +--de.cocolab.reuse.test.IODrv
public class IODrv
extends java.lang.Thread

Tests the IO functionality in classes CocktailWriter and CocktailReader. In other versions of Cocktail this is called the IO package, hence the name of this class.

When main is called with no arguments, a simple set of tests is run. This covers all functions of the package.

When main is called with arguments, a test is run which tests for thread safety in a selected subset of functions.

Field Detail

count

public int count
The number of tests to run.

Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
Test CocktailWriter and CocktailReader.

If no arguments are supplied, the methods with names beginning in and out are executed. These make up a complete test of the basic functionality.

With arguments, a thread safety test is run. This concentrates on the integer formatting method, because this is tuned for performance and makes use of a static buffer. Results are automatically checked by means of a parallel (inefficient) algorithm. Performance data is produced.

The test data is produced with a specific seed so that the tests are repeatable except for timing issues related to threading.

Parameters:
argv[0] - count: the number of tests to be executed in each thread
argv[1] - threads: how many parallel tests to carry out.

run

public void run()
Thread definition.

Run an automated test according to suplied parameters (see count).

Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

inInt

public static void inInt()
                  throws java.lang.Throwable
Testing input of integers, using specific input.

outInt

public static void outInt(CocktailWriter out)
                   throws java.lang.Throwable
Testing output of integers. Specific values are tested; the output should consist of pairs of identical lines separated by blanks.

randomInt

public static void randomInt(long seed,
                             int count)
                      throws java.lang.Throwable
Random testing of integer output. Random test data is generated based on a fixed seed (so that the data set is repeatable). Results are checked by writing into a string buffer and comparing with a result calculated with an alternative algorithm.
